messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] journals
messages.msgSnippet: ... I liked Joyce s response on this, but my husband (who s been reading over my shoulder today) tells me that I should let everyone know that there really ARE
messages.messageBody:
12/15/02 19:01:

>> Maybe I am not journaling right. But that sounds like it shouldn't be
>> possible kinda like asking a stupid question.

I liked Joyce's response on this, but my husband (who's been reading over my
shoulder today) tells me that I should let everyone know that there really
ARE stupid questions.

They're the ones somebody just has to ask after the class or meeting has
gone on way, way, way too long, and the person in charge has finally (to
everyone's relief) said, "Well, if there are no more questions, I guess we
can go." Everything asked after that point is stupid.

Do you get the impression that my husband spends too much time in meetings
and army classes and is getting just a teensy bit cynical? <eg>

brenda
